nodes.text: The H-7 "Equalizer" blaster pistol was a type of blaster pistol manufactured by Coronet Arms, and was considered to have been a masterpiece of blaster pistol design. It was thought of as both a work and a functional weapon, and featured clean lines and bronzium plating, with a streamlined, tubiform aesthetic. The Equalizer teetered on the edge of a heavy blaster pistol classification, as a result of its accuracy, energy output, and space for aftermarket kits.

They were released by Coronet Arms in limited numbers due to the Equalizer's extensive handcrafting that went into every blaster pistol, which made it a major status symbol among what few CorSec officers and successful free traders wielded them. Outside the Corellian sector, the H-7 was exceptionally rare, being found in the collections of the most dedicated and knowledgeable gun enthusiasts. The waiting list was always months long, despite the pistol's being triple the average price.
